title.narrative: OUTPUT 3.4 ADO:CP RELATED EMERGENCY INTERVENTIONS (0780/AO06/880/004)

description.narrative: Children aged 10-18 years and their families most affected by the disaster have improved access to child protection services that facilitate recovery and build resilience to promote a return to normalcy after an emergency., which contributes to Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, adolescent boys and girls, especially the most deprived, live free from violence, have capability to reach their full potential and contribute to a cohesive and resilient society.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children aged 10-18 years and their families most affected by the disaster have improved access to child protection services thatfacilitate recovery and build resilience to promote a return to normalcy after an emergency.

description.narrative: In 2021 with UNICEF support, the Government and other partners provided mental health and psychosocial support services for 5,126 children (MHPSS) and 1,686 parents/primary caregivers across the country. In addition, 336 children living in 21 childcare institutions received MHPSS support and 3,782 vulnerable children and families received recreation and positive parenting kits during lockdown. UNICEF also supported a digital case management system at the divisional level reaching 367 children in need of care and protection. Finally, thanks to the partnership with religious leaders, over 15,000 community members were reached with COVID health and hygiene messaging. | Status:Met | As-of Date:01/02/2022
